Hi Doug, 
 
I don't think the blade is overpriced.............. it is a rare work by
a highly rated smith with Tok. Hozon papers. Granted he is not giving it
away, but the big "name" dealers would certainly not charge less than
this in my opinion (infact probably at least a couple of thousand
more..............), and it has provenance (where the seller purchased
it). It is not one of those "finds" which usually turn out to be alot
less grand than stated by the seller. 
 
Anyway it doesn't make much difference to me as I can't afford it at the
moment, but if I could I would seriously consider it. I believe Robert
referred to this blade earlier as having an "etched" design ? No such
thing, this is a genuine piece of art. Not some piece of Chinese
rubbish. 
 
And ofcourse anything koto Soshu den is going to cost you an arm and a
leg. There seem to be more collectors in that area, generally driving
prices up. 
 
Well I believe I have said enough now considering I still know nothing
in the big scheme of things hahahahahah. Anyone who wants to put their
foot in my mouth, feel most welcome. 
 
Matt 

-----Oorspronkelijk bericht-----
